data.title: Oscar Pedroso - 2015-16 - Men's Basketball

24 Oscar Pedroso

Bio

Stats

Historical

Biography

2015-16 (Senior): Named to the Academic All-Pacific West Conference honor roll ... played all 27 games with 10 starts ... averaged 9.3 ppg and 2.6 rpg ... shot 43.3 percent from the floor, 39.8 from 3-point range and 73.5 at the free throw line ... set career-highs with points (23), 3-pointers made (6), 3-pointers attempted (9) and assists (3) at Alaska (Nov. 14) ... matched high in assists at Azusa Pacific (Jan. 9) ... career-best seven rebounds twice at Holy Names (Feb. 1) and Azusa Pacific (Feb. 25) ... set career-highs with 8-for-10 free throws against HNU.

2014-15 (Junior): Named to the Academic All-Pacific West Conference Team ... played in 16 games with three starts ... averaged 7.8 points and 1.8 rebounds per game ... had 11 assists, six steals and three blocks ... shot 51.2 percent from the floor, 16-of-40 (40 percent) from 3-point range and 20-of-28 (71.4 percent) from the free throw line ... played in 13 of the team's final 17 games after making only three appearances in team's first nine games ... averaged 14.8 ppg in final five games played, going 25-of-43 (58.1 percent) from the floor during that stretch ... season-high 17 points twice (Feb. 8 at Hawai'i Pacific; Feb. 21 vs. Holy Names) ... season-best four rebounds three times ... made season-high three 3-pointers against BYU-Hawai'i (Feb. 5) and Academy of Art (Feb. 28) ... season-high 5-of-6 from free throw line vs. Academy of Art (Feb. 28).

Previous school: Attended Cuesta College in San Luis Obispo, Calif. where he was a two-time Western State Conference First Team honoree … was the conference's Player of the Year in 2013-14 and named to the California Community College Athletic Association First Team, leading the Cougars to the WSC North Division title and a berth in the CCCAA Southern California Regional playoffs … averaged 17.8 points, 5.1 rebounds and 2.1 assists per game with 50 steals in 2013-14 … finished sixth in career scoring at Cuesta with 997 points … free throw percentage of 78.3 ranks seventh in Cougar history.

High School: Graduate of D. Dinis High School in Porto, Portugal … played club basketball for FC Porto and G.D.B.Leca … won numerous club championships including the national championship in 2007.

Personal: Parents are Maria Vieira and Oscar Pedroso … was a member of the Portuguese Junior National Team … majoring in Business … likes to go to the beach, hanging out with friends, soccer and surfing the internet.
